Description: Cornelian pendant in the form of Ptah; he wears a close-fitting garment with an embroidered band down the middle in front; facial details engraved; horizontal suspension hole drilled through projection at back at shoulder level; polished.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Enkomi, surface find (found in a shaft[?] near tomb 93)
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (640)
